__inputs.name: VAR_ENDPOINT
__inputs.label: Set it to /admin for admin dashboards to consult usage statistics of any user. For user dashboards that restrict data to current logged user, set it to empty space
__inputs.description: Set it to /admin for admin dashboards to consult usage statistics of any user. For user dashboards that restrict data to current logged user, set it to empty space

panels.title: Aggregate Usage Statistics of User ${user} from ${__from:date:YYYY-MM-DD HH:mm:ss} to ${__to:date:YYYY-MM-DD HH:mm:ss}

panels.description: Average usage statistics of all jobs of the user
panels.title: ‚öôÔ∏è Average Utilization by ${user} ‚öôÔ∏è

panels.description: Total energy consumption of all jobs of the user
panels.title: ‚ö° Total Energy Consumption by ${user} ‚ö°

options.content: # README The panels to the left show the overall usage by the user **${user}** using the project **${account}** during the period ${__from:date:YYYY-MM-DD HH:mm:ss} to ${__to:date:YYYY-MM-DD HH:mm:ss}. - Average CPU, GPU, CPU memory and GPU memory usage is the average over all the jobs of the user during the above stated period. - Total energy usage is the total energy consumed by the jobs of the user during the above stated period. - Host corresponds to the energy consumption by host components such as CPU, CPU memory and other peripherals of the node excluding GPU (if present) - GPU corresponds to the energy consumption of GPUs alone. - Total is the sum of power consumption of Host and GPUs. - Total emissions is the total equivalent emissions due the energy consumed by the jobs of the user during the above stated period. Real time emission factors [RTE eCO2](https://www.rte-france.com/en/eco2mix/co2-emissions), [Electricity Maps](https://app.electricitymaps.com/map/72h) and static emission factor from [OWID](https://ourworldindata.org/co2-and-greenhouse-gas-emissions) are supported in the estimation of the emissions. - Host is the equivalent emissions due to the energy consumed by host components such as CPU, CPU memory and other peripherals of the node excluding GPU (if present) - GPU is the equivalent emissions due to energy consumption of GPUs alone. - Total is the sum of equivalent emissions of Host and GPUs.

panels.description: Total emissions from the energy consumption of all jobs of the user using emission factor from RTE eCO2 mix data
panels.title: üë£ Total Equivalent Emissions estimated using ${provider:text} by ${user} üë£

options.content: # README The panels to the left show the overall usage by the project **${account}** during the period ${__from:date:YYYY-MM-DD HH:mm:ss} to ${__to:date:YYYY-MM-DD HH:mm:ss}. This includes the usage of all the users in the project. For consulting only user specific usage, please refer to the panels above. - Average CPU, GPU, CPU memory and GPU memory usage is the average over all the jobs of the user during the above stated period. - Total energy usage is the total energy consumed by the jobs of the user during the above stated period. - Host corresponds to the energy consumption by host components such as CPU, CPU memory and other peripherals of the node excluding GPU (if present) - GPU corresponds to the energy consumption of GPUs alone. - Total is the sum of power consumption of Host and GPUs. - Total emissions is the total equivalent emissions due the energy consumed by the jobs of the user during the above stated period. Real time emission factors [RTE eCO2](https://www.rte-france.com/en/eco2mix/co2-emissions), [Electricity Maps](https://app.electricitymaps.com/map/72h) and static emission factor from [OWID](https://ourworldindata.org/co2-and-greenhouse-gas-emissions) are supported in the estimation of the emissions. - Host corresponds to the energy consumption by host components such as CPU, CPU memory and other peripherals of the node excluding GPU (if present) - GPU is the equivalent emissions due to energy consumption of GPUs alone. - Total is the sum of equivalent emissions of Host and GPUs.

panels.description: Total emissions from the energy consumption of all jobs of the user using emission factor from RTE eCO2 mix data
panels.title: üë£ Total Equivalent Emissions estimated using ${provider:text} by ${account} üë£
Aggregate Usage Statistics of Project ${account} from ${__from:date:YYYY-MM-DD HH:mm:ss} to ${__to:date:YYYY-MM-DD HH:mm:ss}

panels.description: Total energy consumption of each user in the project ${account}
panels.title: ‚ö° Total Energy Consumption by users of ${account} ‚ö°

panels.description: Total emissions from the energy consumption of all jobs of the user using emission factor from RTE eCO2 mix data
panels.title: üë£ Total Equivalent Emissions  estimated using ${provider:text} by users of ${account} üë£

options.content: # README The panels to the left show the breakdown of total energy consumption and equivalent emissions for project **${account}** during the period ${__from:date:YYYY-MM-DD HH:mm:ss} to ${__to:date:YYYY-MM-DD HH:mm:ss}. - Total energy consumption is sum of energy consumed by host and GPUs (if present) for all jobs ran during this period. - Total equivalent emissions is the sum of equivalent emissions from the energy consumed by host and GPUs (if present) for all jobs ran during this period. Real time emission factors [RTE eCO2](https://www.rte-france.com/en/eco2mix/co2-emissions), [Electricity Maps](https://app.electricitymaps.com/map/72h) and static emission factor from [OWID](https://ourworldindata.org/co2-and-greenhouse-gas-emissions) are supported in the estimation of the emissions.

panels.title: Breakdown of ${account}'s Energy & Emissions Usage  from ${__from:date:YYYY-MM-DD HH:mm:ss} to ${__to:date:YYYY-MM-DD HH:mm:ss}

panels.description: List of all SLURM jobs of user ${user} with project ${account}. By clicking the row, user will be redirected to the dashboard that shows the time series metrics of that compute unit.
